snippet: The overhaul, named for Senator Frank R. Lautenberg, Democrat of New Jersey, would be the first significant rewriting of the Toxic Chemicals Safety Act.
abstract: Senate approves bill overhauling chemical safety system that effectively re-writes 1976 Toxic Substances Control Act; unanimously vote on separate measure that bans use of beads in beauty products that lead to polluted waterways and threaten marine life.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and JOHN SCHWARTZ
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn reported from Washington, and John Schwartz from New York.

lead_paragraph: The overhaul, named for Senator Frank R. Lautenberg, Democrat of New Jersey, would be the first significant rewriting of the Toxic Chemicals Safety Act.

headline.main: Senate Votes to Overhaul Chemical Safety and Ban Beads in Beauty Products
headline.print_headline: Senate Votes to Overhaul Chemical Safety and Ban Beads in Beauty Products
